title: Local Food
name: Local Food
description:
A Map by Spinneyhead

Local, independent food shops.  I want to populate the map with alternatives to supermarkets.  Butchers, fishmongers, delis, cheese shops, maybe even cafes, if it's part of the community put it on this map.

properties.name: Axons of Didsbury butchers
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Traditional butchers in Didsbury

properties.name: Barbakan
properties.description: Posted by DrfilippoM21 9PWThe Barbakan: a Chorlton institution. Once an excellent Polish bakery and delicatessen, it\'s now a wide-ranging and innovative bakery, deli, sandwich shop and cafe - and they still do the Polish specialities (mmm, cheesecake). If you\'ve never shopped at the Barbakan, you must never have been to Chorlton.

properties.name: Bradshaw Butchers
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Family Butchers in Withington

properties.name: Burton Road Butchers
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead FAmily run butchers on Burton Road, West Didsbury.

properties.name: Burton Road deli
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead A deli, cafe and sandwich shop on Burton Road, Withington.

properties.name: Cheese Hamlet
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Incredible cheese shop in Didsbury.

properties.name: Evans of Didsbury
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Fishmongers, butchers and grocers.

properties.name: Fusion Deli
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Nice modern deli in West Didsbury.

properties.name: Inshore Fisheries
properties.description: Posted by DrfilippoM21 9ASFishmonger of the old school; still going strong, now selling cuttlefish, fresh sardines and duck eggs alongside the haddock and cod. I can recommend the organic salmon. Address: 484 Wilbraham Rd (temporarily relocated to the precinct).

properties.name: Katsouri's deli
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead

properties.name: Love Saves The Day
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead This is the third location for Love Saves the Day (maybe fourth, I\'m not sure). This one is on the site of the former Atlas deli. The stock\'s not as good as it used to be, but it\'s a good place for coffee and sandwiches under the railway.

properties.name: M Strafford butchers
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead

properties.name: Manchester Farmers' Markets
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead   Manchester Farmers\' market is held on the second and foutrth Friday and Saturday of each month. I tend to buy meat from Savin Hill farm and fudge from Uncle Pete\'s.

properties.name: Olive deli
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead Across the road from UMIST main building and on the edge of the Gay Village I would occasionally get my lunch from here when I was studying at City College\'s city centre site.

properties.name: Robinson's Butchers
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead

properties.name: Unicorn
properties.description: Posted by Drfilippo Manchester M21 0BNChorlton\'s whole-food grocery superstore. Don\'t ask for animal products of any description, as pitying looks can offend. Great range of fruit and veg, not to mention the organic beer and wine.

properties.name: WH Frost's Butchers
properties.description: Posted by Drfilippo M21 9AQA butcher of quality and distinction; sells everything from shop-made burgers and sausages (I recommend the pork, leek and onion) to shoulders of lamb hacked to size while you wait (and watch). Q Guild member, some organic meat. Good sandwiches at lunchtime, too. Address is 12-14 Chorlton Place (i.e. the precinct).

properties.name: Whales fish market, Manchester Arndale
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead

properties.name: Wild at Heart
properties.description: Posted by Drfilippo M21 0RQDelicatessen specialising in organic meat, dairy, honey and other animal products. Expensive but worth a look. (Address is 1 Railway Terrace - not in Google Maps!)

properties.name: Withington Healthfoods
properties.description: Posted by Spinneyhead
